page.title: 03VILLAGE CHURCH
page.content: ST. MICHAEL'S CHURCH was built in the fourteenth century.It is thirty one metres long. It has a clock with two faces that chime every hour. At the bottom of the church there is an altar for christening babies.The church has eight bells and three gargoyles.The church was rebuilt in 1833 because it was badly in need of repair.The tower is of the fifteenth century and is in three stages with an embattled parapet of chequer work.The Kirby parish chests house the church registers which stands on the north aisle under the "St.Cecelia" window.
